page.title: 07Oldmeldrum School system
page.content: During 1984 and 1985 teachers in Meldrum School joined teachers throughout Scotland in intermittent strike action for better conditions, disrupting education in the primary school. The effect was to create a lack of continuity felt especially in the early stages i.e. children aged 4-7. Parents in and around Oldmeldrum joined in the campaign, not only to help the local teachers achieve their aims but by using the pressure on Grampian's Director of Education to call for a better system of child supervision. Children in Meldrum School at the end of 1985 are still not supervised in the playgrounds during breaks. Many parents found this unacceptable and wrote to education authorities, local councillors and the Liberal MP for the District.
